item.description:
Thank you all for a wonderful 2008. Our Meetups are the highlight of our month and we look forward to LOTS of good times in 2009.

I think I speak for all of us when I say my heart was truly touched by our special guests from Curly Tail in January. We collected over $500 that day so thank you from the bottom of my heart to all of you who so generously contributed. Unfortunately for Curly Tail, that is about 10% of the funds needed to pay the vet bills from just those 4 pug puppies. We had talked about collecting bottles and cans so if you can bring them to the next Meetup and Kelly and I will return them and donate the cash to Curly Tail. I put a note up at work and I am collecting all of them from work. People hate to return them, so you'd be surprised how many you can get! The other two babies that we could not meet because they were still in the hospital are now stable and fighting for their little lives. Curly Tail is confident they will also be ready for adoption in a month or so. They will need to go to a very quiet, patient home to someone who has the means to cover the lifetime medical care that they will require.

2009 promises to bring a ton of Puggie fun, including our first annual Pug Meetup barbecue...details to come....

Kelly and I truly enjoy being the organizers of the Grafton pug Meetup. We hope that we have met each of you individually, and if we have not, please come up and introduce yourself at the next one. We are constantly trying to come up with new treats for our precious pugs, and ideas to keep it informative and interesting. We welcome all suggestions. It seems to be very personal and we all have tons of fun. We always welcome new members to come join in the fun and excitement at watching our little puggie friends romp and play in the spacious room at the Gibson Kennel in Grafton. Note: this is a PUG meetup...as not all breeds play well together. There are other small breed Meetups, but this is for PUGS ONLY!

******A receipt of current vaccinations must be brought with you in order to enter the play area (kennel rules)********* (this has not been strictly enforced at the meetups but, it's better safe then sorry since the owner of the kennel did request we have this on-hand)

We will ask for a $5 fee per family for each Meetup to cover Meetup costs and any leftover money will be donated to the Pug Rescue of New England or any other Pug charity that we all agree on as a group. These donations go toward paying the monthly dues, snacks and to keep this website going so we can all see when the next meetup is taking place. We will also do special events from time to time to keep it fun and interesting!

Thank you all and I look forward to playing again with all you pug lovers out there and your pups! =)
item.name: The Grafton Pug February Meetup
